text: The 1919–20 Drexel Blue and Gold men's basketball team represented Drexel Institute of Art, Science and Industry during the 1919–20 men's basketball season. The Blue and Gold, led by 2nd year head coach James Barrett, played their home games at Main Building. During this season, in a game against Saint Joseph's, Stanley Twoes made a total of 20 free throws, setting a school record. ==Roster== ==Schedule== |- !colspan=9 style="background:#F8B800; color:#002663;"| Regular season |- ==References== Category:Drexel Dragons men's basketball seasons Drexel Category:1919 in sports in Pennsylvania Category:1920 in sports in Pennsylvania
title: 1919–20 Drexel Blue and Gold men's basketball team
